titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Benjamin Williams Crowninshield papers, 1815-1816
titlestmt.author: Processed by: Rubenstein Staff; EAD finding aid derived from MARC record using marc2ead_sectionA.xsl

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid derived from MARC record via marc2ead_sectionA.xsl, September 2018

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

did.abstract: Collection contains letters discussing appointments in the U.S. Navy. One letter (1815) is from Alexander McKim, who discusses the appointment of Dr. Benjamin S. Tyler as Assistant Surgeon in the U.S. Navy. Another is from Gen. Eleazer Wheelock Ripley recommending a midshipman be given his warrant.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.p: Benjamin Williams Crowninshield Papers, 1815-1816, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.p: This finding aid was derived from a MARC record using a crosswalk defined in marc2ead_sectionA.xsl. The finding aid was generated as part of a larger project to digitize several thousand small collections housed in Section A, September 2018.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Boston, Mass. resident. U.S. Secretary of the Navy (1814-1818) and U.S. representative from Massachusetts (1823-1831).

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Collection contains letters discussing appointments in the U.S. Navy. One letter (1815) is from Alexander McKim, who discusses the appointment of Dr. Benjamin S. Tyler as Assistant Surgeon in the U.S. Navy. Another is from Gen. Eleazer Wheelock Ripley recommending a midshipman be given his warrant.

controlaccess.corpname: United States. Navy -- Appointments and retirements
